             Storytelling & Performance/Reel Queer Film Series                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              NYU Storytelling & Performance is a one of a kind program that explicitly focuses on promoting and celebrating the diversity of the LGBTQ community. This program provides a creative approach to reach LGBTQ students of color by featuring program content that would potentially resonate with them. The series gives a platform for these students specifically, to know that their stories or stories similar to theirs are necessary for growth, appreciation, and important enough to be featured on our campus. This program also allows the larger campus community an opportunity to engage in oral story telling and performance, a tradition that has been historically shared by many communities of color as a means of passing down their histories not otherwise written about.   The Real Queer Film Series is a program that brings LGBTQ identified filmmakers to the forefront at our campus. We look to screen feature films that highlight LGBTQ identified actors, producers, directors whom have dedicated their lives to present issues and experiences related to LGBTQ life. This year we are proud to announce that we will have our first Real Queer Film Series screening event at NYU Poly!                                                                               Storytelling and Performance: Past Installments                                 Gun Hill Road (Spring 2012)     No Look Pass (Spring 2012)     Courage Unfolds (Fall 2011)   None on Record (Fall 2011)   XXY (Fall 2011)   Still Black: A Portrait of Black Trans Men (Fall 2011)   Changing House (Fall 2011)   James Baldwin: The Price of the Ticket (Spring 2011)   Contemporary Queer Life in the Dominican Republic (Spring 2011)   Queen of Myself: Las Krudas d'Cuba (Fall 2010)   Coming Out Stories (Fall 2010)   Ten More Good Years (Spring 2010)   Still Black: A Portrait of Black Trans Men (Spring 2010)   Brother Outsider: The Life of Bayard Rustin (Spring 2010)   Angels In America (Fall 2009)                                             A Conversation with Janet Mock and Laverne Cox - Live Stream Video                                                                                                           Center's Hours     Monday - Thursday   |9:00 AM - 8:00 PM|   Friday   |9:00 AM - 5:00 PM|                                                    Join OUTPost The NYU LGBTQ weekly e-newsletter! Gay and Lesbian Performance: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Gay and Lesbian Performance  THEA-UT 624.  4 Credits Instructor(s): Check Albert Cross-listed as a CAS Course : DRLIT-UA 137 A survey of contemporary lesbian and gay plays from The Boys in the Band to Angels in America. The goal of the course is to familiarize students with lesbian and gay plays written since 1968 as a discrete body of work within the field of contemporary theatre. The course focuses on plays and playwrights that have had a significant impact in the representation of homosexual life onstage. In addition, students consider the historical, political, and cultural developments from which gay theatre emerged and, through independent research projects, examine the communities that emerged in the process of creating gay theatre. Check Albert for course schedule. Gay and Lesbian Performance: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Gay and Lesbian Performance  H28.0624  4 Credits Instructor(s): J. Jeffreys Call #: 70901 Thursday, 2:00-4:45 pm    This course explores over 400 years of gay and lesbian characters and themes in Western theatre and performance. From Marlowe to Kushner, Broadway to the cutting edge of performance, the class looks at gay and lesbian identities across time and performance genres against a background of cultural, social, sexual and critical history. See class Web site for further details.
